OUS Card: This report summarizes the percentage of activities that overlap with this nearshore plan, as reported in the Ocean Use Survey. Plans should consider the potential impact to sectors if access or activities are restricted.
OUS Card - learn more:
‚ÑπÔ∏è Overview: to capture the value each sector places on different areas of the nearshore, an Ocean Use Survey was conducted. Individuals identified the sectors they participate in, and were asked to draw the areas they use relative to that sector and assign a value of importance. Individual responses were then combined to produce aggregate heatmaps by sector. This allows the value of areas to be quantified, summed, and compared to one another as more or less valuable.

Value is then used as a proxy for measuring the potential economic loss to sectors caused by the creation of protected areas. This report can be used to minimize the potential impact of a plan on a sector, as well as identify and reduce conflict between conservation objectives and sector activities. The higher the proportion of value within the plan, the greater the potential impact to the fishery if access or activities are restricted.

Note, the resulting heatmaps are only representative of the individuals that were surveyed.

üéØ Planning Objective: there is no specific objective/target for limiting the potential impact to fishing activities.

üó∫Ô∏è Methods:

<5><0><0>Spatial Access Priority Mapping Overview

üìà Report: Percentages are calculated by summing the areas of value within the MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by all sector value in the nearshore planning area. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
SDM Card: This report summarizes the key species habitat protected by this plan, based on species distribution models. The higher the percentage, the greater the protection of areas used by key species.
SDM Card - learn more:
‚ÑπÔ∏è Maintaining populations of key species requires protecting habitats which support those species. This report can be used to inform which key species' habitats would be protected by this plan. The higher the percentage, the greater the protection of these species.

üéØ Planning Objective: there is no specific objective/target for key species habitat.

üó∫Ô∏è Source Data: The species distribution models (SDMs) used in this report are from the Ara√∫jo Lab. SDMs model probability of presence of individual species in a given area. While these SDMs are based partly on collected observational data, they are models and thus have baked-in uncertainty.

üìà Report: Percentages are calculated by taking the total area of the species' distribution within the MPAs in this plan, and dividing it by the total area of the species' distribution in the nearshore. If the plan includes multiple areas that overlap, the overlap is only counted once.
SizeCard - introduction: Nearshore waters extend from the shoreline out to 6 nautical miles. This report summarizes nearshore plan overlap with the 6nm boundary, measuring progress towards achieving planning targets.
SizeCard - learn more:
<0> This report summarizes the size and proportion of this plan within these boundaries.

If plan boundaries overlap with each other, the overlap is only counted once.
